    This is filled in down below.

    Desc

    Methods are defined protected by method_defined? because at this point the C-library or Java library is already loaded, and we don't want to clobber any methods that have been defined there.

    Is this element a block element?

    # File lib/nokogiri/html/element_description.rb, line 7
def block?
  !inline?
end
    default_sub_element() click to toggle source 
    # File lib/nokogiri/html/element_description_defaults.rb, line 62
def default_sub_element
  d = default_desc
  d ? d.defaultsubelt : nil
end

    # File lib/nokogiri/html/element_description_defaults.rb, line 48
def deprecated?
  d = default_desc
  d ? d.depr : nil
end
    deprecated_attributes() click to toggle source 
    # File lib/nokogiri/html/element_description_defaults.rb, line 76
def deprecated_attributes
  d = default_desc
  d ? d.attrs_depr : []
end
    description() click to toggle source 
    # File lib/nokogiri/html/element_description_defaults.rb, line 55
def description
  d = default_desc
  d ? d.desc : nil
end

def implied_end_tag?

  d ? d.endTag : nil
end

def implied_start_tag?

    Inspection information

    # File lib/nokogiri/html/element_description.rb, line 19
def inspect
  "#<#{self.class.name}: #{name} #{description}>"
end

    Convert this description to a string

    # File lib/nokogiri/html/element_description.rb, line 13
def to_s
  "#{name}: #{description}"
end

    default_desc() click to toggle source 
    # File lib/nokogiri/html/element_description_defaults.rb, line 21
def default_desc
  DefaultDescriptions[name.downcase]
end
